author: Michael Larabel
description: Eric Engestrom today released Mesa 25.2.7 as the newest bi-weekly point release for this stable set of open-source (predominantly) OpenGL and Vulkan drivers for Linux systems...
title: Mesa 25.2.7 Ships The Latest Open-Source OpenGL & Vulkan Driver Fixes

author: Michael Larabel
description: Just hours ago Valve announced the new Steam Controller along with the Steam Frame VR headset and new Steam Machine. While these new Steam hardware products won't be available until early 2026, Valve has just-now upstreamed support for the new Steam Controller to the SDL3 library...
title: Valve Already Upstreams Support For The New Steam Controller To SDL3

author: Michael Larabel
description: Valve just sent over the press release announcing three new Steam Hardware devices...
title: Valve Announces New Steam Machine, Steam Controller & Steam Frame

author: Michael Larabel
description: With the upcoming release of Weston 15.0, this Wayland reference compositor will finally feature a Vulkan renderer. For those curious about its potential, a presentation recently outlined the current state of this Vulkan code path...
title: The State Of The Vulkan Renderer For Wayland's Weston 15.0 Compositor

author: Michael Larabel
description: As covered recently on Phoronix there has been several exciting improvements for aging AMD Radeon GCN 1.0 and GCN 1.1 era graphics cards for the open-source AMD Linux graphics driver stack. This work has been led by Timur Kristóf of Valve's Linux Open-Source Graphics Driver Group with an ultimate goal of shifting the GCN 1.0/1.1 open-source Linux driver hardware support from the aging "Radeon" kernel graphics driver over to the "AMDGPU" kernel driver already used by default for all AMD GPUs/accelerators from GCN 1.2 and newer...
title: Valve's Open-Source Radeon Linux Driver "Love Song For Gamers With Old GPUs"

author: Michael Larabel
description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10.1 has reached general availability with a number of enhancements to this leading enterprise Linux distribution. As with so many things in 2025, AI is a big focus for RHEL 10.1...
title: Red Hat's RHEL 10.1 Released With systemd Soft-Reboots, Easier AI Accelerator Drivers

author: Michael Larabel
description: Back in August with the Vulkan 1.4.327 spec update was the introduction of VK_VALVE_video_encode_rgb_conversion as a Valve vendor extension. The open-source Radeon Vulkan "RADV" driver has now merged support for this extension that is being used now by Steam Link VR...
title: RADV Driver Adds Valve Video Extension Used By Steam Link VR

author: Michael Larabel
description: Open-source developer Tomeu Vizoso who developed the open-source and reverse-engineered "Rocket" accel driver for the Rockchip NPU and also worked on the Etnaviv/Vivante NPU support and other related code like Mesa's Teflon is teasing new NPU drivers coming in the new year...
title: At Least Two New Open-Source NPU Accelerator Drivers Expected In 2026

author: Michael Larabel
description: Webmin continues serving as one of the best open-source, web-based server management control panels for Linux and other Unix-like platforms. Webmin 2.600 is out today with yet more features and a refined theme...
title: Webmin 2.600 Web-Based System Administration Tool Brings "Biggest UI Update"

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Haiku open-source operating system project inspired by BeOS has published their October 2025 status report...
title: Haiku OS Made Many Kernel & App Improvements In October
